Generation IV.Diamond: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.
Generation IV.Pearl: The toxin made in its poison sacs is pumped to the knuckle claws through tubes down its arms.
Generation IV.Platinum: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Swaying and dodging the attacks of its foes, it weaves its flexible body in close, then lunges out with its poisonous claws.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Swaying and dodging the attacks of its foes, it weaves its flexible body in close, then lunges out with its poisonous claws.

Generation V.Black: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.
Generation V.White: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.
Generation V.Black 2: The croaking that Toxicroak produces before a battle is for churning the poison it has stored in its poison sac.
Generation V.White 2: The croaking that Toxicroak produces before a battle is for churning the poison it has stored in its poison sac.

Generation VI.X: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.
Generation VI.Y: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.

Generation VIII.Sword: It bounces toward opponents and gouges them with poisonous claws. No more than a scratch is needed to knock out its adversaries.
Generation VIII.Shield: It booms out a victory croak when its prey goes down in defeat. This Pokémon and Seismitoad are related species.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: The toxin made in its poison sac is pumped to the knuckle claws through tubes down its arms.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Its crimson claws contain a virulent toxin. This toxin can be made into a tonic by diluting it, mixing it with several types of wild grass, and boiling it down over two days.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Swaying and dodging the attacks of its foes, it weaves its flexible body in close, then lunges out with its poisonous claws.
Generation IX.Violet: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.
